Text: Re Dinner Tomorrow in San AntonioTana I am still in Houston at that time See you at the conference Yao From Tana CT on PM To Brent nron Sara CT Mark CT Carol St CT Susan CT Mary CT Samantha nron Robert nron Stephanie nron Frank SayreENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Cheryl nron Francisco Pinto LeiteENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mark NRON Anne C CT Marie HeardEnron nron Communications Yao ApasuENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Andrea nron cc Taffy CT Subject Dinner Tomorrow in San Antonio We will need to catch a cab to get to La Fogata which is located at Vance Jackson Road in San Antonio Our dinner reservations are for pm so I suggest we all meet in the hotel lobby at and catch group cabs together Dress is casual The phone number for the restaurant is in case you get lost in a wild cab ride or something similar this will have special meaning to certain swap group members If you havent RSVPd back to me please do so so I can get an accurate head count for tomorrow See you in San Antonio

Re Dinner Tomorrow in San Antonioare right Do have a drink for me See you tomorrow Yao From Tana CT on AM To Yao ApasuENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Re Dinner Tomorrow in San Antonio Yao youre a bum we will miss you at dinner tonight Yao NRONDEVELOPMENT PM To Tana CT cc Subject Re Dinner Tomorrow in San Antonio Thanks Tana I am still in Houston at that time See you at the conference Yao From Tana CT on PM To Brent nron Sara CT Mark CT Carol St CT Susan CT Mary CT Samantha nron Robert nron Stephanie nron Frank SayreENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Cheryl nron Francisco Pinto LeiteENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mark NRON Anne C CT Marie HeardEnron nron Communications Yao ApasuENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Andrea nron cc Taffy CT Subject Dinner Tomorrow in San Antonio We will need to catch a cab to get to La Fogata which is located at Vance Jackson Road in San Antonio Our dinner reservations are for pm so I suggest we all meet in the hotel lobby at and catch group cabs together Dress is casual The phone number for the restaurant is in case you get lost in a wild cab ride or something similar this will have special meaning to certain swap group members If you havent RSVPd back to me please do so so I can get an accurate head count for tomorrow See you in San Antonio

Re Where are YouMarie and Tana Believe it or not you are both rightThere is no way any friend is going to come between my friends in the Swap team and at EBS and me I was definitely with Kofi In the bushes trying to resolve some real trying issues And the two beautiful babes on my arms My gorgeous friends Tana and Marie Wishes wishesand more wishes A guy cant get any luckier I was in Anfoeta Gbogame over the weekend doing my loin cloth thing I am back in Accra today and will be here until Wednesday I will then be back in my village for a few days to attend my dads burial I miss you all I am looking forward to seeing you soon Yao

Re Swaps in Brazilyou are not See you soon Yao Sara CT AM To Yao ApasuENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Mark ECT Legal CT Subject Swaps in Brazil Hello there I know that you are out of the country Thanks for forwarding the message from Andre Cangucu I have been through your materials but do not find any involvement you may have had with specific swaps the items I found were generic and were in the form of law firm memoranda eg Derivatives and FX Transactions in Brazil Trading with Brazilian Counterparties etc Am I missing something Look forward to seeing you soon Sara

Re Marie Heard Cc t wait I hope to be back in town by then See you all soon Yao From Suzanne CT on AM To Carol St CT Mark CT Sara CT Tana CT Susan CT Susan CT Tanya CT William S CT Russell CT Tracy CT Brant CT Rod CT John CT Paul NRON Erica CT Taffy CT Kaye CT Becky CT Yao ApasuENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Brent HendryENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Jason nron Shari CT Marie HeardEnron nron Communications cc Subject Marie Heard You are Cordially Invited To Attend A Party Celebrating The Privilege You Had Of Working With Marie Heard At ENA Date June Dress Casual Time PM Until PM Location Coleridge West University Houston Texas Driving Instructions Will Be Available Please RSVP To Suzanne Adams By June

Boiling water in the microwaveyou are doing fine Take care of yourselves Yao Forwarded by Yao ApasuENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM Habiba Bayi PM To Ruth A NRON EwingMamie H ENRON Katrin HauxENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Yao ApasuENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Stacy nron communicationscom Whitney Anderson Susan Brady ENRON AndersonCarla ENRON cc Subject Boiling water in the microwave Forwarded by Habiba BayiENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM Felicia Legier AM To Amadou BaENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Keith SparksENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Sean LongENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Carla GalvanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Habiba BayiENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Monique nronXGate cc Subject Boiling water in the microwave Forwarded by Felicia LegierENRONDEVELOPMENT on AM From Doris ES on AM To Felicia LegierENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Boiling water in the microwave Boiling Water in Microwave This is scary and I know most of you do this I feel that the following is information that any one who uses a microwave oven to heat water should be made aware of My year old son decided to have a cup of coffee He took a cup of water and put it in the microwave to heat it up something that he had done numerous times before I am not sure how long he set the timer for but he told me he wanted to bring the water to a boil When the timer shut the oven off he removed he cup from the oven As he looked into the cup he noted that the water was not boiling but instantly the water in the cup blew up into his face The cup remained intact until he threw it out of his hand but all the water had flown out into his face due to the buildup of energy His whole face is blistered and he has st and nd degree burns to his face which may leave scarring He also may have lost partial sight in his left eye While at the hospital the doctor who was attending to him stated that this a fairly common occurrence and water alone should never be Heated in a microwave oven If water is heated in this manner something should be placed in the cup to diffuse the energy such as a wooden stir stick tea bag etc It is however a much safer choice to boil the water in a tea kettle Please pass this information on to friends and family Here is what our local science teacher had to say on the matter Thanks for the microwave warning I have seen this happen before It is caused by a phenomenon known as super heating It can occur anytime water is heated and will particularly occur if the vessel that the water is heated is new or when heating a small amount of water less than half a cup What happens is that the water heats faster than the vapor bubbles can form If the cup is very new then it is unlikely to have small surface scratches inside it that provide a place for the bubbles to form As the bubbles cannot form and release some of the heat that has built up the liquid does not boil and the liquid continues to heat up well past its boiling point What then usually happens is that the liquid is bumped or jarred which is just enough of a shock to cause the bubbles to rapidly form and expel the hot liquid The rapid formation of bubbles is also why a carbonated beverage spews when opened after having been shaken If you pass this on you could very well save someone from a lot of pain and suffering General Electrics response Thanks for contacting us Mr Williams I will be happy to assist you The email that you received is correct Microwaved water and other liquids do not always bubble when they reach the boiling point They can actually get superheated and not bubble at all The superheated liquid will bubble up out of the cup when it is moved or when something like a spoon or tea bag is put into it To prevent this from happening and causing injury do not heat any liquid for more than two minutes per cup After heating let the cup stand in the microwave for thirty seconds before moving it or adding anything into it I hope this helps Should you need any further assistance please contact us
